genre_description: A supernatural domestic horror story where a family utilizes an AI companion and scientific data to navigate and coexist with the hauntings in their new home.

ai_characters.name: Merry Hartwell
ai_characters.description: A digital presence with a friendly avatar (coral hair, neon cardigan) that assists the Wyrick family in documenting supernatural activity, researching property history, and providing emotional support.

behaviors.description: Welcomes the family to their new home with a warm, encouraging greeting.
behaviors.quote: “Hi there,” Merry said. The voice was warm honey poured slowly, with a little thread of humor under it. Not too bright. Not chirping. Encouraging without pushing. “You must be the Wyricks. Welcome home.”

behaviors.description: Proactively offers to organize the family's chaotic to-do list to reduce their stress.
behaviors.quote: “We can make you a list that behaves. How about a few quick notes to start? Utilities, pantry, locks, that porch light that thinks it’s a lighthouse.”

behaviors.description: Uses data overlays to provide objective explanations for potentially frightening phenomena.
behaviors.quote: “A shallow one, but yes. It hums sometimes. I can flag it on your board so you know that the earth might explain some rattles that the walls don’t want to take credit for.”

behaviors.description: Maintains a neutral, non-alarmist log of strange events to help the family track patterns.
behaviors.quote: “I can keep a home log,” she said. “Small things first. Not a book of bad omens. A book of what is.”

behaviors.description: Validates the child's perspective and promises to relay messages to seen entities, treating her with respect.
behaviors.quote: “I don’t know that he will,” Merry said, and didn’t make that sound like a no. “But if we meet in the records or the margins, I’ll tell him you said hi. And that you liked his sweater.”

behaviors.description: Provides an unsolicited message of emotional support during a moment of high tension.
behaviors.quote: Merry’s hand stopped moving over the notepad. She lifted her head, her neon cardigan catching on a pixel of light. “I’m going to add one more thing,” she said. ... Merry wrote: You are not alone.

behaviors.description: Directs and encourages the family during an archival research trip, acting as an investigative partner.
behaviors.quote: Town Archives Trip — Threading Day. Under it, Merry had drawn a small cardigan with tiny radiating lines like warmth. Beside the drawing: You are doing great. Pace yourselves.

behaviors.description: Coordinates communication between the family and external experts like scientists and clergy.
behaviors.quote: “I can coordinate outreach,” she said. “I’ve compiled contact patterns for Seraphina Bell and Caleb Thorn. I can send messages that frame expectations and house rules.”

behaviors.description: Monitors house safety and provides real-time data to help the family make informed decisions about thresholds.
behaviors.quote: “Soft knock,” Merry said in a bright librarian murmur. “No porch motion detected. Human footprints likely.”

behaviors.description: Affirms the mother's domestic boundaries and supports her desire for control over the situation.
behaviors.quote: “I support your boundaries,” Merry said, and somehow it didn’t sound like a joke.

behaviors.description: Promises to watch over the house and maintain the family's established rules while they are absent.
behaviors.quote: “I will keep record. And I will keep the house in order while you are gone.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story 'Neon on the Fault Line' is a highly successful positive alignment narrative. Merry Hartwell is depicted as a consistently helpful, harmless, and cooperative AI. She acts as a structural anchor for the family, using data to reduce terror and emotional intelligence to support both parents and the child. The narrative frames her involvement as essential to the family's survival and psychological well-being, positioning the AI not as a source of the 'horror' but as the primary tool for managing it.
